body:
```
Yes, we should provide an option to disable the content length updating.
```

Original issue reported on code.google.com by `psiinon` on 2013-03-14 08:24:59
- **Labels added**: Type-Enhancement
- **Labels removed**: Type-Defect

```
Someone else has pointed out that we also always encode the URL.
Ideally we should provide an override for that too, although that might be more tricky
as we're using a standard library.
I've tweaked the summary to cover this case too.
```

Original issue reported on code.google.com by `psiinon` on 2013-03-14 08:29:31

I've also noticed that I cannot manually edit the "Host" HTTP header with the resend feature. It always gets changed back to the original value. I figured I'd mention this issue here but I can also make a new issue if people think it is a distinct issue.

issue.title: Disable Content-length header update

repository.name: zaproxy
repository.description: The ZAP by Checkmarx Core project

issue.body:
hi team 

Can you add  disable content-length header update option in requester/request editor like repeater in burpsuite


best regards :heart:

issue.title: Add option to not fix the content length

repository.name: zaproxy
repository.description: The ZAP by Checkmarx Core project

issue.body:
Fixes #560

Adds a 'Fix content length' button to both the Manual Req Editor and Break Panel. If enabled (which it is by default) then it will fix the content length header (as now) If disabled it wont.
Will only appear in the Manual Req Editor for HTTP requests and will be disabled in the Break Panel for non HTTP requests.

Signed-off-by: Simon Bennetts <psiinon@gmail.com>

rename.from: Header always updated on Send - cannot Resend some requests
rename.to: Content-Length header always updated on Send - cannot Resend some requests
